headline: Micron (MU) Stock Trades Down, Here Is Why
summary: Shares of memory chips maker Micron (NYSE:MU) fell 8.8% in the afternoon session after the company reported first-quarter (fiscal Q2 2025) results, which came with high expectations, but while the overall performance was decent, softness in key markets, weaker margins, and inventory concerns overshadowed the positives.

headline: Micron’s Margin Pressure Overwhelms AI Boost
summary: Micron is getting a definite piece of the artificial-intelligence boom.  High-bandwidth memory, or HBM, that is used in AI systems designed by companies like Nvidia was a star performer, with quarterly sales exceeding $1 billion for the first time ever— surging more than 50% from just three months ago.  Micron caused additional concern by noting on its conference call that it expects gross margins to be “up somewhat” in the August-ending quarter—suggesting a shortfall to the three-point sequential gain analysts had been expecting.

headline: Chipmaker Micron's shares slump as tepid margin forecast eclipses AI prospects
summary: Micron's shares fell 8% on Friday, as its dour margin forecast took the shine off a robust quarterly revenue outlook driven by demand for its semiconductors used in artificial intelligence tasks. Micron, one of only three providers of high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips for data-intensive generative AI applications, forecast adjusted gross margin below estimates on Thursday, as lower pricing for consumer memory chips hits profitability. After a 1.4% drop in 2024, Micron's shares have gained more than 13% this year as investors bet on improving consumer memory chip pricing and expected the company to benefit from its essential position in AI supply chains.

After a 1.4% drop in 2024, Micron's shares have gained more than 13% this year as investors bet on improving consumer memory chip pricing and expected the company to benefit from its essential position in AI supply chains.

headline: Micron Stock Falls After Earnings. The Detail That Overshadowed Strong Results.
summary: Micron  Technology stock was falling early Friday as guidance for lower profit margins overshadowed its better-than-expected earnings.  Micron shares were down 7% at $95.83  in early trading.  Micron said that sales of HBM chips surpassed the $1 billion milestone in its fiscal second quarter, ahead of its own estimates and up 50% sequentially.

headline: Micron warns of margins miss this quarter. Its stock is dropping.
summary: Micron Technology (MU) shares are in the red on Friday, reversing from initial gains seen after reporting better-than-expected fiscal second quarter results after the market close on Thursday. Selling pressure on Micron stock comes amid a wider sell-off and uncertainty around the sustainability of the artificial intelligence (AI) trade. Market Domination hosts Julie Hyman and Josh Lipton, along with Epistrophy Capital Research chief market strategist Cory Johnson, report more on Micron's performance and its outlook in the semiconductor landscape. Catch CFRA Research senior equity analyst Angelo Zino's commentary to Yahoo Finance on Micron's high bandwidth memory chips. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.
